page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES IN ARMTHORPE
page.content: { A child's life}in Armthorpe{around {1920}was very different from that of children today. There were just a few old cottages surrounded by woods and fields,which disappeared as the village developed. Children had a long walk to{school } and returned home for lunch.They attended school from 5 years to 14 years.Writing was done on slates and they did not have the variety of equipment or lessons of today.The school day was about the same length as it is today. There weren't any buses but on market days you could sometimes get a lift to town on a horse and cart.{Cooking}was done on a coal fire and there weren't any electric irons or washers.They had {bathrooms}but children were bathed in tin tubs in front of the fire.{Good {children}were given a penny on Friday.
